website_summaries.verdict: Trusted testing prep brand name offers a well-rounded book with many study options.
pros: Purchase of the book includes online access to practice tests and video lessons
Huge book that features more than 2,000 practice questions
Well-organized to help you find the subject matter you need help on
cons: Takes a lot of time to go through materials

customer_reviews.title: Think before you buy
customer_reviews.text: I also have a daughter who is prepping to SAT this year. Based on her experience, this didn't help her as much. One thing I want to call out us the Vine reviews I see versus the real experience of studying this book and commenting based on real experience. My daughter didn't get this book for free so this is a unbiased opinion of the content.
customer_reviews.author: AMZShopper

customer_reviews.title: "Smart" purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This book is very thorough! It's huge and has more than enough content to help your student and justify the price. Just make sure they don't attempt to go cover to cover otherwise its useless and they'll give up on it (but that's not how to study for the SAT anyway). There is a lot of info in here so order it as early as possible so you have the time to utilize it all.
customer_reviews.author: Home

customer_reviews.title: Look used with no video or online content
customer_reviews.text: The description and picture of the product are showing that it is an Online + Video but when I received the package there were no online content or DVD within the package. In fact, it appears to be a used book and not a new book. Buyers should be aware of this false description.
customer_reviews.author: Glenroy Brown

customer_reviews.title: User friendly workbook
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my 17 year old to use over the summer. Wish it came with disc. He says that the workbook is easy to follow. His tutor told me she is gong to recommend it for some of her other students.
customer_reviews.author: GiGi4life

customer_reviews.title: Lot of information
customer_reviews.text: If only it came with instuctions on how to get your teen to use it..lol
customer_reviews.author: A. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book
customer_reviews.text: this book is put together in a great format. Very easy to glide through it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B.

customer_reviews.title: useful
customer_reviews.text: looks pretty useful student still need help if they are using it for first time.
customer_reviews.author: mausam

customer_reviews.title: Same tests as Kaplan Prep Plus 2021
customer_reviews.text: Bought this book and the Kaplan Prep Plus 2021. Thought we were going to get 10 different tests total. Nope. They are the same.
customer_reviews.author: JennHan

customer_reviews.title: NOT a DVD addition
customer_reviews.text: Description and picture of the product is showing that it is a Online + DVD edition but when I received the book there was no DVD with it.
customer_reviews.author: rahik

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Information
customer_reviews.text: This book is really thick but that’s because it has lots of information and covers everything. I recommend this book for those who are taking the SAT.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Only 2 tests in the book not 5.
customer_reviews.text: Kaplan books need to stop trying to trick people by saying “5 tests” on the cover without being clear. There are only TWO tests in the book. Make sure to read all the fine print. I’ve learned now all Kaplan books say some number of tests but what they actually mean is half of that number will be in the book and the other half is online. Be more straight forward with people and write “2 tests in the book and 3 tests online.” Don’t try to sell more books by tricking people into thinking they’re getting 5 practice tests in the book with additional online content.
customer_reviews.author: Clee

customer_reviews.title: Great Prep Book
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Granddaughter who's a senior in high school to help with her college-entrance test preparations. Her Mom helped with the review, too. This book is well organized with a great amount of information and practice for the SAT. Although she has not yet taken the exam, the book is helping her feel more comfortable as we get closer to that test date. The general test-taking hints are also useful for the ACT (which she has already taken). Considering the cost and importance of college-entrance exams, this book is well worth it. Recommended. Review of:  "SAT Total Prep 2020: 5 Practice Tests + Proven Strategies + Online + Video (Kaplan Test Prep) Paperback – June 4, 2019"
customer_reviews.author: Alan Sailor

customer_reviews.title: the ONLY book you'll need
customer_reviews.text: Pros - comprehensive - easy to follow - on par with actual SAT questions (eg. harder than the SAT sample questions from the college board) - online timed mode cons - requires good reading comprehension - students need to be disciplined about timing to get through the book in time my twins are using this book and kahn academy to study for the SATs. While videos are great for reinforcing concepts, this book tackles the style of questions the SAT presents to students. Half the book covers math, the remaining sections cover reading, writing & language, essay, and practice tests. i took photos of some pages, and the online website. the explanations were clear and concise.
customer_reviews.author: engk916

customer_reviews.title: Huge and helpful for the cost....
customer_reviews.text: I know people who have spent thousands on classes, etc.. My son is starting to prepare now and so this comes at a great time. The book is HUGE but it is put together well and it's easy to go through it bit by bit. My son has started and does some every day. The online portion is fine. From what I understand, the more practice tests you can take, the better, so every little bit helps. His scores on practice tests are pretty good so far, so maybe it's helping. If you your school doesn't offer help, or you want more and can't afford private tutors or classes, this is a good option. It's also a good supplement.
customer_reviews.author: Morley Dotes

customer_reviews.title: Good for additional test practice, using the strategies learning in class.
customer_reviews.text: First, IF you are able to afford a good SAT/ACT test prep class, I highly recommend it. The summer after the freshman or sophomore year is an excellent time to take these classes. The SAT and ACT tests are less about knowledge and more about strategy. The class my son is taking uses The College Board and the Princeton Review books, which we like. Obviously, the more practice you can do using the strategies learned is even better. This book is my son's additional practice.
customer_reviews.author: MomtoBoys

customer_reviews.title: Timed practice
customer_reviews.text: I was more helped by the practice tests than the helpful hints and strategies. Was not impressed by Kaplan’s online component either, I’d rather see more personalized content. But you’d probably need to sign up for an online prep class to get something like that. But if funds are limited and you have the patience to sit and repeatedly take these practice tests under timed conditions, you’ll definitely see improvement in your scores.
customer_reviews.author: LawyerMom

customer_reviews.title: laid out well
customer_reviews.text: Teen says content laid out well. Helpful format. Good study information. Said that it would be really helpful if the book had a comprehensive index so that you can find the specific things you are wanting to study if you aren't going through the whole book. Said it takes forever to locate things without one. Otherwise good resource.
customer_reviews.author: Picky CO Mom

customer_reviews.title: through and easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sat prep book. It has test taking strategies, practice questions with explanations, and through information about the different sections of the test and the best ways to approach them. There’s also the practice tests themselves which my daughter has found very helpful but having the information to go through first is so much better than just the practice tests alone.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Very well organized!
customer_reviews.text: This book is very well organized. It looks terrifying at first, but it is organized to make studying less daunting. Everything is laid out nicely and it even gives study tips. My daughter is already feeling less stressed about SATs. She feels like this will make her more prepared.
customer_reviews.author: LadyDevlyn

customer_reviews.title: No doubt this will be very helpful
customer_reviews.text: This is a thick comprehensive book for SAT 2020 from Kaplan. It is more than a thousand pages tackling Math and English. From Algebra, linear equations, trigonometry, inequalities to essays and reading strategies. It is daunting but if you take it in stride, you'll find it interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Nuk

customer_reviews.title: Great option for test prep
customer_reviews.text: My junior has been working his way through this book and it has been a great confidence boost for him. Moreover, at $23 it feels like a great value when compared to other options, particularly when you consider Kaplan's excellent reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Mohlman

product_meta.title: SAT Total Prep 2021: 5 Practice Tests + Proven Strategies + Online + Video (Kaplan Test Prep)
